abstract: Iraqi officials and freed captives say Islamic State militants released around 200 members of country's Yazidi religious minority, most of them sickly or elderly, to relieve the burden of providing food and medicine for them.
lead_paragraph: Nearly 200 members of the Yazidi religious minority in Iraq might have been released because Islamic State militants could no longer provide food and medicine for them, former captives and Iraqi officials said.
snippet: Nearly 200 members of the Yazidi religious minority in Iraq might have been released because Islamic State militants could no longer provide food and medicine for them, former captives and Iraqi officials said.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

headline.main: Freedom for Yazidis, After Months of Torment
